name: UPaperTileMapComponent
doc:
A component that handles rendering and collision for a single instance of a UPaperTileMap asset.

This component is created when you drag a tile map asset from the content browser into a Blueprint, or
contained inside of the actor created when you drag one into the level.

NOTE: This is an beta preview class.  While not considered production-ready, it is a step beyond
'experimental' and is being provided as a preview of things to come:
 - We will try to provide forward-compatibility for content you create.
 - The classes may change significantly in the future.
 - The code is in an early state and may not meet the desired polish / quality bar.
 - There is probably no documentation or example content yet.
 - They will be promoted out of 'beta' when they are production ready.

@see UPrimitiveComponent, UPaperTileMap

UseSingleLayerIndex: The index of the single layer to use if enabled
bUseSingleLayer: Should we draw a single layer?
bShowPerTileGridWhenSelected: Should this component show a tile grid when the component is selected?
bShowPerLayerGridWhenSelected: Should this component show an outline around each layer when the component is selected?
bShowOutlineWhenUnselected: Should this component show an outline around the first layer when the component is not selected?
bShowPerTileGridWhenUnselected: Should this component show a tile grid when the component is not selected?
bShowPerLayerGridWhenUnselected: Should this component show an outline around each layer when the component is not selected?
TileMap: The tile map used by this component

methods.name: AddNewLayer
methods.doc:
Creates and adds a new layer to the tile map
Note: This will only work on components that own their own tile map (OwnsTileMap returns true), you cannot modify standalone tile map assets

methods.name: CreateNewTileMap
GetLayerColor
methods.doc: Gets the per-layer color multiplier for a specific layer (multiplied with the tile map color and passed to the material as a vertex color)

methods.name: GetMapSize
methods.doc: Returns the size of the tile map

methods.name: GetTile
methods.doc: Returns the contents of a specified tile cell

methods.name: GetTileCenterPosition
methods.doc: Returns the position of the center of the specified tile

methods.name: GetTileCornerPosition
methods.doc: Returns the position of the top left corner of the specified tile

methods.name: GetTileMapColor
methods.doc: Gets the tile map global color multiplier (multiplied with the per-layer color and passed to the material as a vertex color)

methods.name: GetTilePolygon
methods.doc: Returns the polygon for the specified tile (will be 4 or 6 vertices as a rectangle, diamond, or hexagon)

methods.name: MakeTileMapEditable
methods.doc:
Makes the tile map asset pointed to by this component editable.  Nothing happens if it was already instanced, but
if the tile map is an asset reference, it is cloned to make a unique instance.

methods.name: OwnsTileMap
methods.doc: Does this component own the tile map (is it instanced instead of being an asset reference)?

methods.name: RebuildCollision
methods.doc: Rebuilds collision for the tile map

methods.name: ResizeMap
methods.doc: Resizes the tile map (Note: This will only work on components that own their own tile map (OwnsTileMap returns true), you cannot modify standalone tile map assets)

methods.name: SetDefaultCollisionThickness
methods.doc:
Sets the default thickness for any layers that don't override the collision thickness
Note: This will only work on components that own their own tile map (OwnsTileMap returns true), you cannot modify standalone tile map assets

methods.name: SetLayerCollision
methods.doc:
Sets the collision thickness for a specific layer
Note: This will only work on components that own their own tile map (OwnsTileMap returns true), you cannot modify standalone tile map assets

methods.name: SetLayerColor
methods.doc:
Sets the per-layer color multiplier for a specific layer (multiplied with the tile map color and passed to the material as a vertex color)
Note: This will only work on components that own their own tile map (OwnsTileMap returns true), you cannot modify standalone tile map assets

methods.name: SetTile
methods.doc:
Modifies the contents of a specified tile cell (Note: This will only work on components that own their own tile map (OwnsTileMap returns true), you cannot modify standalone tile map assets)
Note: Does not update collision by default, call RebuildCollision after all edits have been done in a frame if necessary

methods.name: SetTileMap
methods.doc: Change the PaperTileMap used by this instance.

methods.name: SetTileMapColor
methods.doc: Sets the tile map global color multiplier (multiplied with the per-layer color and passed to the material as a vertex color)
